intro: Centaurea trichocephala, commonly known as the hairy-headed centaurea, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its most distinctive feature is the fluffy, white to pale blue crown of bracts that resembles a small cloud or puffball. Centaurea trichocephala is often found in open woodlands, grasslands, and along coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
